title: Translate ASSEMBLY to C [closed]
content:
How to translate code assembly to C?? I am very poor in assembly code. EG:

```
mov     dword ptr [ebp+data], 612E2F47h
mov     dword ptr [ebp+data+4], 5B2A451Ch
mov     dword ptr [ebp+data+8], 6E6B5E18h
mov     dword ptr [ebp+data+0Ch], 5C121F67h
mov     dword ptr [ebp+data+10h], 0D5E2223h
mov     dword ptr [ebp+data+14h], 5E0A5F1Dh
mov     word ptr [ebp+data+18h], 858h
mov     word ptr [ebp+data+1Ah], 0h
xor     eax, eax                
loc_4012B2:                             
add     [ebp+eax+data], al      
inc     eax                     
cmp     eax, 1Ah                
jl      short loc_4012B2

```

comments.text: Reverse engineering isn't about converting assembly to C, it's about understanding what's going on.
These days it is possible to ask ChatGPT or related models to explain and translate these instructions to C or even to Python. The result here is "G00d J0b guys, k33p 1t up!\x1a\x1b" :-)

answers_data.content:
Here is exact answer to you question.

I wouldn't say that results of this translation to C code are too much understandable.
In addition I'd like to note that learning 6 assembly commands is much less time consuming process.
